creator: Amanda Silberling
title: (No AI) Music generator ProducerAI joins Google Labs
dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
content: Wyclef Jean used Google's AI music tools on his new song "Back in Abu Dhabi."

creator: Rebecca Bellan
title: (No AI) Meta strikes up to $100B AMD chip deal as it chases ‘personal superintelligence’
dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
content: Meta is buying billions of dollars in AMD AI chips in a multiyear deal tied to a 160 million-share warrant, deepening its push to diversify beyond Nvidia and expand data center capacity.
contentSnippet: Meta is buying billions of dollars in AMD AI chips in a multiyear deal tied to a 160 million-share warrant, deepening its push to diversify beyond Nvidia and expand data center capacity.

title: (No AI) Anthropic’s Claude Cowork is plugging AI into more boring enterprise stuff
author: Stevie Bonifield
content:
![Anthropic logo on an orange background.](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/01/STK269_ANTHROPIC_2_D.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

On Tuesday, Anthropic announced [updates to its Claude Cowork platform](https://claude.com/blog/cowork-plugins-across-enterprise) that allow the AI to help with a wider range of office tasks. Claude Cowork can now connect with several popular office apps, including Google Workspace, Docusign, and WordPress. New pre-built plug-ins can also automate tasks in a range of fields, including HR, design, engineering, and finance. Additionally, according to Anthropic, "Claude can now also handle multi-step tasks end-to-end across Excel and PowerPoint," passing context between the two apps.

The update is Anthropic's latest push into AI agents, following the initial [launch of Claude Cowork](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/860730/anthropic-cowork-feature-ai-agents-claude-code) last month. Anthrop …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/883707/anthropic-claude-cowork-updates)
contentSnippet:
On Tuesday, Anthropic announced updates to its Claude Cowork platform that allow the AI to help with a wider range of office tasks. Claude Cowork can now connect with several popular office apps, including Google Workspace, Docusign, and WordPress. New pre-built plug-ins can also automate tasks in a range of fields, including HR, design, engineering, and finance. Additionally, according to Anthropic, "Claude can now also handle multi-step tasks end-to-end across Excel and PowerPoint," passing context between the two apps. 
The update is Anthropic's latest push into AI agents, following the initial launch of Claude Cowork last month. Anthrop …
Read the full story at The Verge.

New pre-built plug-ins can also automate tasks in a range of fields, including HR, design, engineering, […]

title: (No AI) How Claude Code Claude Codes
author: David Pierce
content:
![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/VRG_VST_0224_Site.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Claude Code is a developer tool for developers. And yet, over the last year and especially the last few months, the team at Anthropic has [seen a huge number of people](https://www.theverge.com/report/874308/anthropic-claude-code-opus-hype-moment), across industries and disciplines, figure out how to access their terminal so that they could build new stuff too. Few AI products have found true product-market fit the way Claude Code has. But how did that happen? And are we ever going to get out of the terminal?

![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2025/11/Vergecast-Tile-Large.jpeg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

_Verge_ subscribers, don't forget you get exclusive access to ad-free _Vergecast_ wherever you get your podcasts. Head [here](https://www.theverge.com/account/podcasts). Not a subscriber? You can [sign up here](https://www.theverge.com/subscribe).

On [this episode of _The Vergecast_](https://pod.link/vergecast), Anthropic's Bo …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/podcast/883604/claude-code-ai-future-creator-privacy-vergecast)

title: (No AI) Why we no longer evaluate SWE-bench Verified
content: SWE-bench Verified is increasingly contaminated and mismeasures frontier coding progress. Our analysis shows flawed tests and training leakage. We recommend SWE-bench Pro.
contentSnippet: SWE-bench Verified is increasingly contaminated and mismeasures frontier coding progress. Our analysis shows flawed tests and training leakage. We recommend SWE-bench Pro.

title: (No AI) OpenAI announces Frontier Alliance Partners
content: OpenAI announces Frontier Alliance Partners to help enterprises move from AI pilots to production with secure, scalable agent deployments.
contentSnippet: OpenAI announces Frontier Alliance Partners to help enterprises move from AI pilots to production with secure, scalable agent deployments.

title: (No AI) Gemini 3.1 Pro: A smarter model for your most complex tasks
content: 3.1 Pro is designed for tasks where a simple answer isn’t enough.
contentSnippet: 3.1 Pro is designed for tasks where a simple answer isn’t enough.

title: (No AI) A new way to express yourself: Gemini can now create music
content: The Gemini app now features our most advanced music generation model Lyria 3, empowering anyone to make 30-second tracks using text or images.
contentSnippet: The Gemini app now features our most advanced music generation model Lyria 3, empowering anyone to make 30-second tracks using text or images.

creator: Michael Pollan
title: (No AI) AI Will Never Be Conscious
dc:creator: Michael Pollan
content: In his new book, A World Appears, Michael Pollan argues that artificial intelligence can do many things—it just can’t be a person.
contentSnippet: In his new book, A World Appears, Michael Pollan argues that artificial intelligence can do many things—it just can’t be a person.

creator: Brian Barrett, Zoë Schiffer, Leah Feiger
title: (No AI) Uncanny Valley: AI Researchers’ Resignations, Bots Hiring Humans, Evie Magazine’s Party
dc:creator: Brian Barrett, Zoë Schiffer, Leah Feiger
content: This episode of Uncanny Valley covers the people resigning from AI companies and the humans getting hired by AI agents. Plus, we attend a soiree thrown by a conservative women's magazine.
contentSnippet: This episode of Uncanny Valley covers the people resigning from AI companies and the humans getting hired by AI agents. Plus, we attend a soiree thrown by a conservative women's magazine.
